metadata.title: Attribution & Analytics Deep Dive — Intus Ecommerce Supplement

rawMarkdown:
# Attribution & Analytics Deep Dive — Intus Ecommerce Supplement
**Supplements:** Deliverable 15 (Measurement Framework & Dashboards)
**Department:** Market Intelligence & Analytics
**Intelligence Source:** Ecommerce Analytics Notebook (2025 benchmarks)
**Date:** February 2026

---

## Why This Supplement Exists

Deliverable 15 built a strong three-phase measurement roadmap (Foundation → Validation → Full Triangulation) with a clear event taxonomy and tiered dashboard. However, it was built before the ecommerce analytics intelligence was available. This supplement adds the specific post-iOS14 attribution realities, Shopify tracking limitations, server-side architecture details, and calibrated benchmarks that Intus needs to make accurate decisions with real data — not platform-inflated numbers.

---

## 1. The Attribution Reality in 2025

### 1.1 Platform-Reported Data Is Not Truth

Every ad platform over-reports conversions because they model data to fill privacy gaps. Here's what Intus needs to know:

| Platform | Attribution Behavior | Impact on Intus |
|----------|---------------------|----------------|
| **Meta (IG/FB)** | Over-reports view-through conversions. Claims credit for sales where the ad was viewed but not clicked. Models data to fill iOS ATT gaps. | Meta ROAS will appear higher than reality. Cross-reference every campaign with Shopify actual sales. |
| **TikTok** | Similar to Meta — heavy reliance on view-through attribution. A user sees a TikTok, searches on Google, buys → TikTok claims the sale. | TikTok will appear to underperform on last-click, but may be driving demand that Google captures. Don't cut TikTok based on GA4 data alone. |
| **Google** | Under-reports social impact. Favors its own capture channels (Search/Shopping). | Google will look like the hero because it captures demand created by Meta/TikTok. This is not the full picture. |
| **GA4** | Uses 90-day attribution window. Session-based, not user-based. Breaks cross-device journeys. | GA4 will under-credit channels where users discover on mobile but convert on desktop (common for $100 activewear purchases). |

### 1.2 The Cross-Device Problem

This is particularly relevant for Intus's audience (18-35, mobile-first):

```
Typical Intus Customer Journey:

Day 1: Sees TikTok ad on phone → scrolls past
Day 3: Sees Instagram retargeting ad → clicks, browses Kit PDP → leaves
Day 5: Googles "Intus activewear" on laptop → purchases

Who gets credit?
- TikTok: "I showed them the ad!" (view-through claim)
- Meta: "I drove the click!" (click-through claim)
- Google: "I converted them!" (last-click claim)
- GA4: Credits Google (last-click default)
- Shopify: Records the sale, no channel credit
- Reality: ALL three channels contributed
```

**Shopify's specific limitation:** Cannot track cross-device journeys. A mobile browse + desktop purchase looks like two different users. This means Shopify's native analytics undercount repeat visitors and over-count new customers.

### 1.3 The "Never Trust a Single Source" Rule

| What to Cross-Reference | How |
|------------------------|-----|
| Meta-reported conversions | Compare with Shopify orders filtered by UTM source |
| Platform ROAS | Compare with MER (total revenue / total ad spend) |
| GA4 channel attribution | Compare with Shopify source data + platform data |
| Any single metric | Triangulate: Platform says X, Shopify says Y, MER says Z → truth is in the overlap |

---

## 2. Server-Side Tracking Architecture

### 2.1 Why Server-Side Is Non-Negotiable

After iOS14/17 and browser tracking prevention, client-side pixels (JavaScript on the page) lose 30-40% of conversion data. Server-side tracking sends data directly from your server to ad platforms, bypassing browser blockers entirely.

### 2.2 Architecture for Intus

```
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                 CUSTOMER BROWSER                     │
│  (limited by iOS ATT, ad blockers, cookie expiry)   │
└─────────────┬───────────────────────────────────────┘
              │ Client-side pixel (backup only)
              ▼
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│              SHOPIFY STORE                           │
│  Orders, customer data, email, phone                │
└─────────────┬───────────────────────────────────────┘
              │ Shopify Webhooks (order_created, checkout_completed)
              ▼
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│     SERVER-SIDE TAG MANAGER / CDP                   │
│  (Google Tag Manager Server Container               │
│   OR Triple Whale / Elevar / Littledata)            │
│                                                     │
│  Hashes PII (email, phone) → sends to platforms     │
└──────┬──────────┬──────────┬──────────┬────────────┘
       │          │          │          │
       ▼          ▼          ▼          ▼
   Meta CAPI   TikTok    Google     GA4
              Events API  Enhanced   Measurement
                         Conversions Protocol
```

### 2.3 Implementation Priority & Tools

| Component | Tool | Priority | Setup Time |
|-----------|------|----------|-----------|
| **Shopify → GA4** | Littledata or Elevar (Shopify app) | Week 1 | 2-4 hours |
| **Meta CAPI** | Shopify native integration (Settings → Marketing) | Week 1 | 1-2 hours |
| **Google Enhanced Conversions** | Shopify → Google Channel app | Week 1 | 1-2 hours |
| **TikTok Events API** | TikTok for Shopify app | Week 2 | 1-2 hours |
| **Server GTM container** | Google Tag Manager Server (Cloud Run hosting) | Week 2-3 | 4-8 hours (technical) |

**Match rate targets:**
- Server-side events should match Shopify order data within 90%+
- If match rate drops below 85%, audit the integration (missing events, incorrect hashing)

### 2.4 First-Party Data Strategy

92% of brands call first-party data "essential" in 2025. For Intus:

| Data Point | Collection Method | Platform Use |
|-----------|-------------------|-------------|
| **Email** | Kit Quiz, "Join the Circle", checkout | Meta Custom Audiences, Klaviyo, GA4 User-ID |
| **Phone** | SMS opt-in (S02), checkout | Meta Custom Audiences, SMS platform |
| **Kit persona** | Quiz result | Segmentation for lookalike audiences |
| **Purchase history** | Shopify | LTV-based audience building for Meta value-based bidding |

---

## 3. Metric Hierarchy: MER vs. ROAS vs. nROAS

### 3.1 When to Use Each

| Metric | Formula | Use Case | Frequency |
|--------|---------|----------|-----------|
| **MER** | Total Revenue / Total Ad Spend | North Star for overall business health. "Is our marketing profitable?" | Daily (pacing), Weekly (trend) |
| **ROAS** | Channel Revenue / Channel Ad Spend | Tactical campaign optimization. "Is this specific campaign efficient?" | Daily |
| **nROAS** | New Customer Revenue / Ad Spend | Scaling decisions. "Are we acquiring genuinely new customers?" | Weekly |
| **Contribution Margin** | Revenue - COGS - Shipping - Returns - Ad Spend | True profitability. "Are we actually making money after all costs?" | Monthly |

### 3.2 Benchmarks for Intus

| Metric | Launch (Month 1-3) | Growth (Month 4-6) | Scale (Month 7+) |
|--------|--------------------|--------------------|-------------------|
| **MER** | >2.5x | >3.0x | >3.5x |
| **Blended ROAS** | >2.0x | >2.5x | >3.0x |
| **nROAS** | >3.0x | >3.5x | >4.0x |
| **Meta ROAS** | >2.5x (remember: over-reported) | >3.0x | >3.5x |
| **Google ROAS** | >4.0x (high-intent capture) | >5.0x | >6.0x |
| **TikTok ROAS** | >1.5x (awareness + halo) | >2.0x | >2.5x |

### 3.3 The "Halo Effect" Test

Don't cut TikTok spend based on last-click ROAS alone. Instead:

1. Run TikTok at current budget for 2 weeks. Track branded search volume.
2. Pause TikTok for 2 weeks. Track branded search volume.
3. If branded search drops when TikTok pauses → TikTok is creating demand that Google captures.
4. This is the "halo effect" — TikTok's real value is higher than its reported ROAS.

---

## 4. Attribution Model Recommendations (Revised)

### 4.1 Updated from Deliverable 15

Deliverable 15 recommended Time Decay (7-day lookback) as the Phase A model. With 2025 ecommerce analytics intelligence, here's the updated recommendation:

| Phase | Primary Model | Rationale |
|-------|--------------|-----------|
| **Phase A (Month 1-3)** | **Data-Driven Attribution (DDA)** in GA4 | AI-driven, assigns fractional credit based on actual contribution. Superior to static rule-based models like Time Decay. GA4 now supports DDA as default for all properties. |
| **Phase B (Month 4-6)** | DDA + Incrementality tests | DDA for daily decisions. Geo-lift tests to validate whether channels are truly incremental. |
| **Phase C (Month 7+)** | DDA + MMM + Incrementality | Full triangulation. DDA for campaign-level, MMM for budget allocation, incrementality for truth-checking. |

### 4.2 Why Data-Driven Over Time Decay

| Factor | Time Decay (Deliverable 15) | Data-Driven (Revised) |
|--------|---------------------------|----------------------|
| **How it works** | Fixed rule: more credit to recent touchpoints | ML model: learns from your actual data which touchpoints matter |
| **Adapts to your business** | No — same formula for every brand | Yes — learns Intus-specific patterns |
| **Handles video discovery** | Poorly — under-credits TikTok/Reels discovery | Better — can learn that video views correlate with later purchases |
| **GA4 support** | Available but legacy | Default in GA4 2025 |

### 4.3 Last-Click Still Has a Role

Use last-click as a **cash-flow check** — "which channel is directly closing sales right now?" — but never as the sole decision-making model. It systematically under-credits:
- Brand awareness (TikTok, YouTube)
- Email nurture (welcome sequences)
- Social proof (UGC exposure)

---

## 5. Incrementality Testing (Enhanced from Deliverable 15)

### 5.1 Budget Requirements

| Test Type | Minimum Budget | Minimum Duration | When to Run |
|-----------|---------------|-----------------|-------------|
| **Geo-Lift (Meta)** | $3,000-5,000 AUD ad spend during test period | 4 weeks | Month 4+ (need baseline data first) |
| **Email Holdout** | No ad budget needed (email is owned) | 4 weeks | Month 3+ |
| **TikTok Halo Test** | Current TikTok budget (just pause/resume) | 4 weeks (2 on, 2 off) | Month 4+ |
| **Studio Channel Validation** | No ad budget (operational cost only) | 4 weeks | Month 4+ |

### 5.2 Geo-Lift Test Protocol (Meta)

**Enhanced from Deliverable 15, Test 1:**

| Parameter | Setting | Note |
|-----------|---------|------|
| **Test market** | Melbourne | Intus home market, highest organic awareness |
| **Control market** | Sydney | Similar demographics, suppress all Meta ads |
| **Budget** | Maintain current Meta spend in Melbourne, $0 in Sydney | Sydney still gets organic + email + TikTok |
| **Measurement** | Compare Shopify sales lift: Melbourne vs. Sydney | Use Shopify shipping address to segment |
| **Success criteria** | Melbourne shows >20% higher sales per capita | Statistically significant lift = Meta is incremental |
| **If no lift** | Meta may be claiming credit for organic demand. Reduce Meta budget, reallocate to TikTok/Google. | This is the value of testing — knowing where NOT to spend |

### 5.3 Real-World Validation

Case study: Honasa (The Derma Co) ran a conversion lift test on Performance Max and found it drove a 37% incremental revenue lift with an incremental ROAS (iROAS) of 0.94 — far higher than their estimated 0.4. Without incrementality testing, they would have under-invested in a profitable channel.

---

## 6. GA4 Custom Event Taxonomy (Enhanced)

### 6.1 Beyond Deliverable 15's Taxonomy

Deliverable 15 defined core events (page_view, view_item, quiz_start, etc.). These additions capture the micro-behaviors that drive optimization:

| Event | Trigger | Parameters | Why Track |
|-------|---------|-----------|-----------|
| `size_guide_view` | Click on size guide/fit tool | item_id, source_page | Fit is #1 friction point in activewear. High usage + low conversion = size guide needs improvement. |
| `variant_select` | Click on color/size swatch | item_id, variant (color/size) | Detect demand for out-of-stock variants. Feed into inventory planning. |
| `video_start` | On-site product video begins | item_id, video_type (lifestyle/product) | Measure video engagement on PDP. |
| `video_complete` | Video watched to end | item_id, video_type, duration | Viewers who complete video convert at higher rates — validate this for Intus. |
| `stock_status_view` | Product viewed when out-of-stock | item_id, variant | Track lost revenue from stockouts. Feed "Notify me" signup rate. |
| `notify_signup` | "Notify me when back" submission | item_id, variant, email | Pre-validated demand signal for inventory decisions. |
| `guarantee_view` | Click on 60-day guarantee details | source_page | Measure how many people need guarantee reassurance before purchasing. |
| `kit_compare` | User views 2+ Kit pages in same session | kit_types_viewed | Understand Kit decision process. If high compare + low purchase = confusion. |
| `chat_initiated` | AI shopping assistant opened | source_page, trigger_type | Measure chat impact on conversion (see S01). |
| `upsell_click` | Click on "Complete Your Kit" suggestion | source_item, suggested_item | Track cross-sell effectiveness. |

### 6.2 Event Implementation Priority

| Priority | Events | Why First |
|----------|--------|-----------|
| **Week 1** | size_guide_view, variant_select, stock_status_view | Direct revenue impact — identify friction + lost demand |
| **Week 2** | video_start, video_complete, guarantee_view | Content optimization — understand what content drives conversion |
| **Week 3** | notify_signup, kit_compare, chat_initiated, upsell_click | Feature optimization — measure new features from supplements |

---

## 7. Dashboard Enhancements (Revised Tiers)

### 7.1 Daily Dashboard (Health Check)

| KPI | Target | Source | Alert Threshold |
|-----|--------|--------|----------------|
| **MER** | >2.5x (launch), >3.0x (growth) | Shopify Revenue / Total Ad Spend | <2.0x for 3+ days |
| **Blended ROAS** | >2.0x | Platform data (directional only) | <1.5x for 3+ days |
| **Daily CAC** | <$30 AUD prospecting | Platform + Shopify cross-ref | >$45 for 3+ days |
| **Daily revenue** | Pacing to monthly target | Shopify | <70% of daily target |
| **Site sessions** | Growing or stable | GA4 | >20% decline day-over-day |

### 7.2 Weekly Dashboard (Optimization)

| KPI | Target | Benchmark Source | Action if Below |
|-----|--------|-----------------|----------------|
| **Conversion rate** | >3.0% | Fashion/apparel benchmark: 3.01% | Audit PDP, checkout, mobile experience |
| **Add-to-cart rate** | >6.5% | Apparel benchmark: 6.3-7.1% | PDP optimization (see S01) |
| **Cart abandonment** | <70% | Industry: 70-75%. >80% = emergency | Audit checkout (see S01 Section 3) |
| **Mobile conversion** | >2.0% | Mobile avg: 1.8%, desktop: 3.9% | Mobile CRO priority (see S01 Section 4) |
| **nROAS** | >3.0x | Calculated (new customer rev / ad spend) | Channel reallocation |
| **Email RPR** | >$0.11 | Campaign email benchmark | Content/segmentation test |
| **SMS RPR** | >$0.80 | Top 10% apparel benchmark (see S02) | Frequency/content test |

### 7.3 Monthly Dashboard (Strategy)

| KPI | Target | Source | Action if Below |
|-----|--------|--------|----------------|
| **Contribution margin** | Positive and growing | Revenue - COGS - Shipping - Returns - Ads | Cost audit (see S04 for operations costs) |
| **New vs. returning customer mix** | 60-70% new (launch phase) → 50/50 (growth) | Shopify | If >80% new: retention problem. If <40% new: acquisition problem. |
| **LTV (60-day)** | >$130 (1.3x first purchase) | Shopify cohort analysis | VIP program not working (see S02 Section 3) |
| **LTV (90-day)** | >$150 | Shopify cohort analysis | Repeat purchase flows need optimization |
| **Return rate** | <18% | Shopify returns data | Fit tools, size guide (see S01 Section 2.2) |
| **List growth (email)** | 3-5% monthly | Klaviyo | Popup optimization (see S02 Section 4) |
| **List growth (SMS)** | 2-3% monthly | Klaviyo | SMS opt-in rate below 15% at checkout |

---

## 8. Platform Discrepancy Handling Protocol

When platform data conflicts with Shopify (which it will), use this decision framework:

| Scenario | What's Happening | What to Do |
|----------|-----------------|-----------|
| **Meta reports 50 conversions, Shopify shows 35** | Meta is over-counting view-throughs | Use Shopify as truth for revenue. Use Meta data for creative optimization (relative performance between ads). |
| **Google reports high ROAS, TikTok reports low** | Google is capturing demand TikTok created | Run the halo test (Section 3.3). Don't cut TikTok based on last-click. |
| **GA4 shows different numbers than Shopify** | Cross-device breaks, consent mode gaps, session vs. transaction mismatch | GA4 for journey analysis, Shopify for revenue truth. |
| **MER looks good but nROAS is low** | You're retargeting existing customers, not acquiring new ones | Separate new vs. returning in all platform campaigns. Increase prospecting budget. |
| **All platforms claim credit for the same sale** | Attribution overlap (normal) | This is why triangulation exists. Total attributed conversions will always exceed actual conversions. Use MER as the reality check. |

---

## 9. Implementation Timeline

### Week 1: Server-Side Foundation
- [ ] Install Elevar or Littledata for Shopify → GA4 server-side events
- [ ] Enable Meta CAPI through Shopify native integration
- [ ] Enable Google Enhanced Conversions via Google Channel app
- [ ] Set up basic daily dashboard (MER, ROAS, CAC, revenue)

### Week 2: Extended Tracking
- [ ] Install TikTok Events API via TikTok for Shopify app
- [ ] Implement custom GA4 events (Priority 1: size_guide_view, variant_select, stock_status_view)
- [ ] Set up weekly dashboard in Looker Studio or Shopify + GA4 combined view
- [ ] Validate server-side match rates (target: 90%+ match with Shopify orders)

### Week 3: Advanced Events
- [ ] Implement Priority 2 custom events (video, guarantee, chat)
- [ ] Switch GA4 attribution model to Data-Driven Attribution (default in 2025)
- [ ] Set up nROAS tracking (separate new vs. returning in platform campaigns)
- [ ] Begin MER tracking alongside platform ROAS

### Month 2-3: Validation Prep
- [ ] Accumulate 3 months of baseline data across all channels
- [ ] Implement Priority 3 custom events (kit_compare, upsell_click, notify_signup)
- [ ] Set up monthly dashboard with contribution margin calculation
- [ ] Plan geo-lift test design for Month 4

### Month 4+: Incrementality
- [ ] Execute geo-lift test (Meta: Melbourne vs. Sydney)
- [ ] Execute email holdout test (10% holdout)
- [ ] Execute TikTok halo test (2 weeks on, 2 weeks off)
- [ ] Compare incrementality results with DDA attribution — calibrate

---

*Supplement S05 of 5 — Intus Ecommerce Intelligence Layer*
*Supplements Deliverable 15: Measurement Framework & Dashboards*
